sen.j: 広沢真臣（ひろさわ さねおみ、天保4年12月29日 (旧暦)（1834年2月7日） - 明治4年1月9日 (旧暦)（1871年2月27日）、正字体は廣澤眞臣）は、日本の武士（長州藩士）、政治家。
sen.e: Saneomi HIROSAWA (広沢真臣: February 7, 1834 - February 27, 1871; his name is also written in the prescriptive orthographic style as 廣澤眞臣) was a samurai (a feudal retainer of the Choshu clan) and statesman in Japan.
sen.cmt: 広沢真臣→Saneomi HIROSAWA （名前の漢字表記を加えました。）
sen.e: Saneomi HIROSAWA (広沢真臣: February 7, 1834 - February 27, 1871; his name is also written in the prescriptive orthographic style as 廣澤眞臣) was a samurai (a feudal retainer of the Choshu clan) and statesman in Japan.

sen.j: 1864年（元治元年）、長州藩は禁門の変、下関戦争、長幕戦争と厄続きであったため、藩内の政権闘争で主戦派（主に長州正義派）が恭順派（主に俗論派）に敗れた。
sen.e: In 1864, the Choshu Domain was consecutively hit by adversities, such as the Kinmon Incident, the Shimonoseki War, and the Choshu-Bakufu War, and this series of misadventure lead the belligerent war faction (mainly formed by "Choshu Justice Party" [reformists of the Choshu clan])'s loss in a power struggle with the deference faction (mainly formed by conventional party).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。長州正義派→"Choshu Justice Party" (reformists of the Choshu clan) としました。恭順派→the deference faction としました。俗論派→conventional party としました。

sen.e: Affected by the tug of war, Kingo HATANO was also incarcerated in Noyamagoku jail, however, he escaped execution since he was not a member of the Choshu Justice Party.

sen.j: 1865年（慶応元年）、亡命生活を余儀なくされていた高杉晋作が伊藤春輔・山縣狂介らを説得して軍事クーデターを起こし、正義派が長州藩の政権を奪還する。
sen.e: In 1865, Shinsaku TAKASUGI, who was living in exile, launched a military coup d'etat, persuading Shunsuke ITO, Kyosuke YAMAGATA and others to join, and the Justice Party succeeded in regaining the control of the Choshu Domain.

sen.j: すると既に処刑されていた正義派の面々に代わって正義派に最も近かった中間派の尊王攘夷の志士波多野金吾が政務役として藩中枢に参加することとなった。
sen.e: As a result, Kingo HATANO, who had the closest ideology to that of the Justice Party among the moderate supporters of Sonno Joi (the doctrine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians), came to take part in the pivot of the domain as an official in charge of policy affaires, taking the place of the principal members of the Justice Party, who hade been already executed.

sen.j: 維新政府の発足後は、参与、海陸軍務掛、大総督府参謀を務め、その後、内国事務掛、京都府御用掛、参議を歴任。

sen.e: According to the autopsy by a doctor, there were 13 wounds in total including 3 stab wounds in the throat.

sen.j: 犯行後、同室にいた妾は捕縛されていたものの軽傷を負っただけで、現場の状況など不自然な点が多々見られた。
sen.e: After the crime, many unnatural points were observed at the scene, including the fact the his mistress escaped with only minor injury although she was bound
After the crime, many unnatural points were found at the scene, including the fact the his mistress received only minor injury although she had been tied in the same room.
sen.cmt: observed→found,escaped with→received,was bound→had been tied と修正しました。「同室にいた」、ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: After the crime, many unnatural points were found at the scene, including the fact the his mistress received only minor injury although she had been tied in the same room.

sen.j: 横井小楠、大村益次郎に続く維新政府要人の暗殺であり、広沢を厚く信頼していた明治天皇は「賊ヲ必獲ニ期セヨ」という犯人逮捕を督促する異例の詔勅が発せられた。
sen.e: This was the third magnicide against the restoration government leaders, after Shonan YOKOI and Masujiro OMURA, and Emperor Meiji, who highly trusted in Hirosawa, gave an extraordinary Imperial rescript to urge the capture of the criminals as ''to ensure the arrest of the perpetuators.'
sen.cmt: 「賊ヲ必獲ニ期セヨ」→定訳不明'to ensure the arrest of the perpetuators.' としました。

sen.j: 広沢家の家令と妾に対する苛烈な捜査の結果、両者の密通や広沢家の私金流用の事実も判明した。
sen.e: As a result of severe interrogations of the Hirosawa family's butler and Hirosawa's mistress, it was revealed that these two had illicit intercourse and misused the Hirosawa family's private money.
As a result of severe investigation into the Hirosawa family's butler and Hirosawa's mistress, it was revealed that these two had illicit intercourse and misused the Hirosawa family's private money.

sen.e: As a result of severe investigation into the Hirosawa family's butler and Hirosawa's mistress, it was revealed that these two had illicit intercourse and misused the Hirosawa family's private money.

sen.j: 1875年には陪審員列席による裁判が行われたものの、結局、両者は無罪となり釈放された。
sen.e: Although a trial was held with the presence of jury members, at last, they were sentenced not guilty and released.
Although a trial was held with the presence of jury members in 1875, but at last, they were found not guilty and released.
sen.cmt: 「1875年には」を補いました。at last→but at last,sentenced→found と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Although a trial was held with the presence of jury members in 1875, but at last, they were found not guilty and released.

sen.j: 多くの者がこの暗殺事件を迷宮入りと観念する中、木戸孝允だけは捜査を督促し続けた。
sen.e: While many people anticipated that this case of assassination would remain unsolved, only Koin KIDO continued urging further investigation.
While many people accepted that this case of assassination would remain unsolved, only Koin KIDO continued urging further investigation.
While many people accepted that this case of assassination would remain unsolved, only Koin KIDO continued urging further investigation.

sen.j: 捜査に関しては、小河一敏、雲井龍雄、その残党など、80数名が暗殺の容疑者として取り調べられたものの、下手人の特定にさえ至らず、真相は今日に至るまで不明である。
sen.e: In the course of the investigation, around 85 persons were interrogated as suspects, including Kazutoshi Ogo, Tatsuo KUMOI and their remnants, but even the identification of the murderer was not attained, and the real truth is still known today.
sen.cmt: 小河一敏→Kazutoshi Ogo雲井龍雄→Tatsuo KUMOI
sen.e: In the course of the investigation, around 80 people were interrogated as suspects, including Kazutoshi OGO, Tatsuo KUMOI and their remnants, but even the identification of the murderer was not attained, and the truth is still known today.
sen.cmt: 85 persons→80 people （80数名）、 Ogo→OGO,real truth→truth と修正しました。
sen.e: In the course of the investigation, around 80 people were interrogated as suspects, including Kazutoshi OGO, Tatsuo KUMOI and their remnants, but even the identification of the murderer was not attained, and the truth is still known today.

sen.j: 未解決事件であるため、暗殺の下手人・黒幕に関しては諸説あるが、その怨恨的手口・新選組的手口から、維新政府を快く思わない旧幕府側の不平士族や旧幕府軍の残党が下手人・黒幕として一般的に考えられている。
sen.e: As this is an unsolved case, there are various theories about the possible murderers and the mastermind of the assassination, it is commonly thought that fuhei shizoku (former samurai with gripes) of the former bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) side, who felt uncomfortable with the restoration government, or the remnants of the former army of bakufu must have been the assassins and its mastermind

sen.j: 未解決事件であることをいいことに、木戸と広沢の仲が悪かったからだとか、開明派の巨頭である木戸を政府の前面に引っ張り出したい大久保など守旧派による謀略だ、などと願望する向きもある。
sen.e: Some people also take advantage of the situation, in which the case went unsolved, and make opportunistic inferences as follows; because Kido and Hirosawa were not getting well each other, or it was a conspiracy of old-guard crony, such as Okubo, who wanted to drag Kido, the giant of the Kaimei (enlightenment) group, to the public, etc.
sen.cmt: 開明派→the Kaimei (enlightenment) group としました。前面に→ to the public としました。守旧派→old-guard crony としました。
sen.e: Some people also take advantage of the situation, in which the case went unsolved, and make opportunistic inferences as follows; because Kido and Hirosawa were opposing each other, or it was a conspiracy of old-guard party, including Okubo, who wanted to drag Kido, the giant of the Kaimei (enlightenment) group, to the public, etc.
sen.cmt: not getting well→opposing,old-guard crony→old-guard party,such as→including と修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、この当時、薩長土の枢要（木戸孝允・大久保利通・西郷隆盛・板垣退助・山縣有朋たち）は、廃藩置県の準備として御親兵を東京に集めるため、また自藩の藩政改革を更に推し進めるため、参議広沢真臣らに全幅の信頼を置いて東京を留守にしていた。
sen.e: However, at the time, the principal figures of Saccho (Satsuma, Choshu, Tosa Domains) (Koin KIDO・Toshimichi OKUBO・Takamori SAIGO・Taisuke ITAGAKI, Aritomo YAMAGATA, etc.) left Tokyo placing their trust completely in Sangi (councilor) Saneomi HIROSAWA and others to recruit the members Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor) and concentrate them in Tokyo as a preparatory measure prior to the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), and to promote further reform of domain duties of their respective provinces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。枢要→principal figures としました。
sen.e: However, at the time, the principal figures of Saccho (Satsuma, Choshu, Tosa Domains) (Koin KIDO, Toshimichi OKUBO, Takamori SAIGO, Taisuke ITAGAKI, Aritomo YAMAGATA, and others) had left Tokyo leaving their complete trust in Sangi (councilor) Saneomi HIROSAWA and others, to recruit the members Goshimpei (army to convoy the emperor) and gather them in Tokyo as a preparatory measure prior to the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), and to promote further reform of domain duties of their respective provinces.

sen.j: そして、自分たちは何ヶ月もの間、京、大坂、長州、土佐、薩摩を転々としているという状態であった。
sen.e: And they themselves drifted from place to place during months, starting from Kyoto to Osaka, Choshu, Tosa and Satsuma.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: And, they had been drifting from place to place during months, starting from Kyoto to Osaka, Choshu, Tosa and Satsuma.

sen.j: よって、薩長の人間が関与していたとは極めて考えにくい。
sen.e: Therefore, it is extremely difficult to think that someone of the Satsuma Domain or Choshu Domain was involved.
Therefore, it is extremely difficult to think that someone of the Satsuma Domain or the Choshu Domain was involved.
Therefore, it is extremely difficult to think that someone of the Satsuma Domain or the Choshu Domain was involved.

sen.j: 仮に、大村益次郎の遭難同様に薩摩や長州の不平分子が関与していたというのであれば、政府内部で自然に露見し追求されるはずである。
sen.e: If it was true that some discontented elements of Satsuma or Choshu were involved like in the case of Masujiro OMURA's misfortune, it would have been revealed spontaneously and prosecuted.

sen.j: が、そういう情報は全く露見しておらず、極めて不自然である。
sen.e: However, such information has not been discovered, therefore it is quite unnatural to suppose their involvement.

sen.e: Moreover, if some person of Satsuma or Choshu had been involved, those of Dohi (the Tosa and Hizen Domains), who wanted to weaken the influence of Saccho (the Satsuma and Choshu Domains), would not have just looked on with their arms folded..

sen.e: However, in reality the people of Tosa and Hizen were not able to find out any single suspect among the people of Saccho, and it is quite unnatural to arrive at such a conclusion.

sen.e: Accordingly, more than the misfortunes of Toshimichi OKUBO and Tomomi IWAKURA, it is probable that the crime was committed by fuhei shizoku (the former samurai with gripes of the former bakufu side).
